intro: Cryptantha oligantha, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cryptantha oligantha is a hardy species that thrives in low-nutrient conditions and is adapted to survive in harsh climates.
